name: ADULT WHITE DRAGON
speed: 40 ft., Burrow 30 ft., Fly 80 ft., Swim 40 ft.
senses: Blindsight 60 ft., Darkvision 120 ft.; Passive Perception 21

traits.name: Ice Walk
traits.text: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, Difficult Terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
traits.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

actions.name: Rend
actions.text: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 10 ft. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) Slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) Cold damage.

actions.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 19, each creature in a 60-foot Cone. Failure: 54 (12d8) Cold damage. Success: Half damage.

legendary_actions.name: Freezing Burst
legendary_actions.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 30-foot- radius Sphere centered on a point the dragon can see within 120 feet. Failure: 7 (2d6) Cold damage, and the target's Speed is 0 until the end of the target's next turn. Failure or Success: The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Frightful Presence
legendary_actions.text: The dragon casts Fear, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14). The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Pounce
legendary_actions.text: The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Rend attack.

Huge Dragon (Chromatic), Chaotic Evil
Like arctic storms, ancient white dragons threaten icy realms. They emerge from their frozen lairs to indulge their hungers for food or treasure, menacing
other creatures with lethal cold. While they might ignore animals or small groups of polar wanderers, these dragons are quick to challenge other dragons
and creatures wielding powerful magic, hoping to add their foes’ skulls and magic items to their own hoards.
